Replies.Reply: Darkness.
Ma'am?
Excuse me... ma'am?
What is this?
Where am I?
What's Newark? A city?
Woah.
I think I'm going to puke.
I don't think I...
Is this...?
Wait a sec. I'm a little out of it here. Where's this train headed?
New York?
Do you know where I got on?
Where's that?
But I've never been to Princeton Junction. See... I don't remember waking up or buying a ticket or getting on the train or anything else. It's just a blank.
Okay. You're gonna figure this out.
Sean Fentress? Who the hell's that?
Ma'am?
I'm having a little problem here.
Like, total memory loss. Complete.
That's not it. See... I'm a pilot.
I was on a mission. Right before I woke up here I was in the middle of a mission...
I'm telling you the truth.
These aren't my clothes. And this wallet here...
You see this? This isn't me.
What?
This can't be happening.
Wake up!
Three months?!
Jesus.
Where am I?
I'm dizzy.
What is this? Who am I talking to?
When?
I was on a train.
And... There was a bomb.
What the hell is going on?!
Who are you?
Goodwin?
How do I know that? I have no idea how I know your name's Goodwin.
Listen to me. Something's wrong.
Who?
I don't get it. Is this a Red Flag exercise?
A... Acknowledge. End of pattern.
Go for pattern recall.
Queen, two nines, four and a three.
Laurie.
No. Lily. Her name was Lily.
Is someone going to tell me what's going on here?
The train.
I have no idea.
I don't know!
Will you tell me what the hell is going on here?
I don't know. Just tell me --
What does this have to do with the train?
Twice.
I don't know who bombed the train!
Hey. What's happening?
Goddamn it, Goodwin, what is all this?
It's a goddamn simulation.
A three dimensional, completely immersive scenario. Touch, taste, sound, sight and smell.
Complete with pretty girl.
Every combat simulator has one. In the middle of a fire fight a pop-up window starts playing a porno.
You're an unusual choice for a distraction.
Find the bomber. Find the bomber.
Everything okay today, chief?
Anything out of the ordinary?
How's it going?
What's your name?
Goodwin? Where are you? It's over. I found him.
Sorry. This guy seemed a little...
Okay. I'm sitting down.
Jesus, he's running away.
A guy just came through here. Did you see where he went?
He was just here. A Middle Eastern-
All better now?
Don't much care for trains myself.
How are you going to pull this off?
Open your briefcase. Prove to me there's no phone in there.
Where the hell's your phone?
I thought so. Now let's see you try to --
You didn't do it.
Holy fuck!
A fucking train just ran over me.
How are you doing this? Am I on some kind of drug?
I didn't find the bomber. You fooled me with the Middle Eastern guy. I went for the diversion.
Guzman. Shell Oil. Look, I don't have intel experience. Why do you have me doing this?
Irrelevant? Killing me each time is irrelevant?
How? How can you do that?
Who's the man with the pipe?
There was a man smoking a pipe. I saw him on the monitor. Who's he?
Let me talk to him. This isn't right. I'm not your prisoner.
What is this? Why are you talking like that? Is this some kind of script?
Who cares? I'm tired of this.
Then what is it? Don't you already know who the bomber is? Don't you have all the answers?
Corpses? Whose corpses? The passengers?
These were real people?
This really happened?
When?
Today?! The train blew up today?
You're lying. I don't believe it.
Where am I, right now, as we speak?
My unit's still in Iraq. I'm flying missions in Iraq. I flew one yesterday!
Then why do I still have Iraqi dirt underneath my fingernails?
Talk to me! Three weeks? I've been back three weeks? How'd I get in here? Have I seen my family?
I'm listening.
Wait. If I'm somehow on that train before it blows up, why don't I just dismantle the bomb?
But all those people dying...
I didn't volunteer for this shit.
How do I know it's real? How do I know you didn't force me to sign it? And how the hell can I be put on a train over and over again -- a train I never was really on?!
I don't believe in time travel, Goodwin. There's no such thing.
Why seventeen? Why me? Why anything?
Let me out! Don't send me back there!
Shit. This is not happening.
You an artist?
Can I see what you're working on?
You don't look like you belong here. The way you're dressed.
I'd really like to see what you're working on. Unless you're worried I won't like it.
So you scribble away on that thing so as not to deal with people.
They're amazing.
Seriously, they're really good, Miss...?
My name's Colter. How many of these passengers have you drawn?
You know all about them?
What about that guy?
Dangerous?
You see anything unusual happen this morning? Anything out of the ordinary?
Has anyone else come out of that bathroom that you remember?
Don't you know? Haven't you seen me here every day for, what, three months?
If I told you that there's a terrorist on this train, that I was sent here to catch him, would you believe me?
Then tell me which one you'd arrest.
Never mind.
Thanks for your help, ma'am.
I don't know. Thirty two?
What happened, Fentress? Who are you? How can I be you?
A KNOCK on the door.
Leave me alone.
Terrorist? Why did you say that?
Stop joking. Who are you? Are you an operative?
Why do you have sketches of everybody on board? Are you part of this?
I can have you arrested. Maybe that's the only way you'll drop the bullshit and talk. Stay put. I'm getting help.
not army. That's Air Force.
They're running this whole thing out of Nellis Air Force Base in Nevada. Fucking Nevada!
What's there? What's on that base?
What did he say?
Christina!
Goodwin? What's happening? Come in. Can you read me? It's goddamn cold in here.
Goodwin, I'm losing oxygen.
Goodwin!
Come on!
Hello? Anyone out there? It's me.
Can you hear me?
I'm here! I'm okay!
Yeah. It's me. Colter.
The capsule lost power. It's still pretty cold in here.
I think so. Who are you?
They wouldn't let me talk to you before.
You're the inventor of this thing.
I don't want to deal with Goodwin anymore.
Don't you understand? He's torturing me. I'm helpless. Can't you get me out of here?
He's a remote operator. And remote operators are risk averse pussies who sit at control screens in the rear while actual pilots like me put their asses on the line in the field.
And just what kind of mission is this? Talk to me, man. Why won't he let me save those people on the train?
Why not? I know what's going to happen. I could take apart the bomb. Stop the train.
What's the difference?
Telling me what?
Is Source Code time travel?
Why can't I save those people on the train?
So...
What happens to the Source Code world after I leave it?
What about the bicycle?
I see it each time. Right after the bomb goes off. Like an after image.
There's a bicycle and a stone wall and a girl. It's a girl from the train. I don't know where any of it is supposed to be, but --
Yeah. Just for a split second.
No. It's there. What do you think it means?
Rutledge, wait. Don't leave me.
I'm alive. No thanks to you.
You're a brick wall, Goodwin. A fucking brick wall.
What do you mean? Let's keep going.
I can give you more. Let me think for a second.
The freight car blows up from the fire. It spews gas, or what could be gas -- it might be chlorine, so they can't take any chances.
So they decide to play it safe and evacuate parts of New York City.
Wall Street. That's what they're going to hit next. The financial markets.
Did she die, too?
You sure she's dead?
She was sitting across from me.
I told you I didn't want to see her!
That's...
He died on the train.
You still have Christina's body?
I want to know about her.
Thirty six dollars and eleven cents.
In your wallet. Right now. Thirty six dollars and eleven cents.
Yes. In five seconds, a guy's going to open a can of soda.
We're about to pass a street with willow trees. Two girls will be jumping rope. A white dog's going to run out behind them. A Dalmatian mix.
Close observation. You could say I'm a collector of moments.
Yes.
You trained to be an artist.
You got A's in line drawing and oil painting. But your work didn't sell. You took a job answering phones in a law firm.
Six months ago you moved back in with your parents. Two weeks ago you put your paints away for good.
You.
But we have, Christina. You've drawn all these people here. You know their routines. At one point you thought you were different from all of them. But now you're not so sure.
I need your help.
Listen to me. I can't use up any more time trying to convince you.
Bear with me.
Please, Christina.
The thing is, that's not me.
No. You drew what you saw, but the person you're seeing now is someone else. I'm not Sean Fentress. I'm not really on this train.
I'm taking someone's place.
I'm serious. Elements in the American military are using me for an experiment. I'm not sure exactly how it all happened, but I'm at a facility on Nellis Air Force Base in Nevada. Right now.
jargon.

I've been put on this train to look for someone. A criminal. And I need to find out just enough about him to keep them putting me back on this train. Because right here's only place I can figure out what's really happening. But I have very little time. And each time I come back, you won't remember me and I'll have to go through this all over again.
Then how do I know all those things about you if we've never spoken before?
Because I think you have the answer to this whole thing.
There's a vision. I keep having it. It's very powerful. And you're in it. And there's a bicycle. And this... old stone wall. And it's very peaceful.
The vision must mean something.
Someone who was trying to help me understand something. Until they got to him.
I don't believe in that shit.
Most of my friends are in the military. My dad runs a melon farm in Alabama.
Me and my dad, we don't see eye to eye. We're just two different people.
Are you always this sarcastic?
What day is it?
June?
Dad?
Dad, it's me. It's Colter.
Been a while, huh? I'd been meaning to call you, but --
He wanted me to stay on and take over the farm but... I had other ideas.
What?
The hell I am.
Dad, don't hang up. We're going to talk. I need your help.
No... it was like he didn't even know who I was.
Sorry to have bothered you.
Forget it.
Thank you, ma'am.
Twenty five?
I just do.
You said you wanted to know.
Shut the door.
It's up here.
Just look.
Acetone Peroxide. It's a liquid explosive. There's fourteen cannisters of it. Simple detonator. Cell phone signal closes the circuit and boom.
No. It was someone else. They don't know who. That's why I'm here. To find out.
It won't matter. The train's already...
I've been sent here. It sounds crazy, but it's true. I've been sent from the future -- from five hours in the future. This train's already been blown up.
You wanted to know. Now you know.
Look. Now the fucking thing can't go off.
Source Code's classified. It wouldn't be in a newspaper.
She found me? What does that mean?
Jesus Christ, Christina, are you going to spit it out?
I see a card.
Let me talk to Rutledge.
Rutledge. Get him.
Will you let me out of here?
Find Rutledge! Now!
Stop! Stop reading from your goddamn script!
I swear to fucking Christ!

I don't need your criticism and I don't need your memory exercises, you gutless freak. And by the way, that bomb is detonated by a cell phone. When activated, the phone's display screen displays caller ID information. Caller ID. I wonder if that information would be useful to Beleaguered Castle.
You'll have to send me back. I didn't get a good look at it. But I will next time.
Goodwin, there's no time left.
Who's walking off with the guy's cell phone. Behind him, the Computer Engineer gets up.
Sorry. Wrong turn.
Las Vegas, Nevada. Nellis Air Force Base.
Is this... Nellis Air Force Base?
I'm trying to reach... Captain Colter Stevens.
Then give me the Combined Air and Space Ops Center.
Who is this?
I'm calling for Rutledge. It's urgent.
This is Captain Colter Stevens.
Colter Stevens. Captain Colter Stevens.
Let me talk to Rutledge.
I'm on the train.
You don't know. It hasn't happened yet.
The explosion.
Don't you understand? I'm in it, Goodwin. I'm calling you from inside the mission. Inside the Source Code.
Goodwin, I'm trapped in this and I can't get out.
No! Wait! Don't hang up! Forget authorization. There's no time.
Good. Now there's a lot of secrecy in all of this, and you have your reasons for that.
But here and now, just this once, I need to ask you something. And you need to tell me the truth.
I'm going to ask it.

Jesus, Goodwin, how can I get through to you? You're not just a soldier. Somewhere inside you're a human being, too. Somewhere inside you've got to know that this is wrong. Source Code is wrong. And if you can't grasp that, if you just follow orders, then you're just as much a prisoner as I am.
Did I survive that helicopter crash in Iraq?
Answer me. Did I survive that crash?
Goodwin.
What?
Not physically? Fuck. At least give me an answer I can understand.
But... the capsule I'm in...
You had no right.
I was a soldier. Then. But now?
After death?
You really want to know?
That's what we do. Keep stuff from each other. Will this ever end?
How can I get out of this?
How?
And then what?
How many times have I done this?
No one knows I'm here. No one can help me.
You can't do this. I served my country. I already gave my life.
What?
Military court or civilian court?
Does that make it any less wrong?
Goodwin?!
I finally get it, Rutledge. You're the good guy, Goodwin's the bad guy. Working together, you get what you want out of me. Why didn't I see it before?
Drop it. I know about the helicopter crash. I know what they've done with me.
What's in it for me?
You can do better than that. They sent you here to offer me a deal.
What's their offer? What can they possibly threaten me with after so colossally fucking me? Spit it out, you spineless turd.
Those after images I saw. You never knew about them. They weren't part of Source Code architecture, were they?

You don't believe that. I've been to places you haven't. I've crossed and recrossed that line between living and dying. And when I do, that veil gets lifted for just a second. And what's there is real. Maybe it's a vision of the next world, but I can see it.
Get there? What do you mean?
You'd never do it. You wouldn't have to. You could just flip the switch and start me back up again unaware. For all I know, you've made this deal with me before.
I'm going to find you, Rutledge.
You hear me? Somehow, I'm going to find you.
I think so. But there wasn't time to read the screen. As soon as it rang the bomb went off.
I was unable examine the phone without separating it from the detonator -- which I was instructed not to do.
Wait. What are you --
Please... I don't feel good...
I don't know... I honestly... I can't keep...
Go ahead! Open your fucking soda!
Ma'am, please... return to your seat.
Why did you just do that?
Will you do me a favor?
Get off the train.
Please. Just get off the train.
You shouldn't have been on this train, Christina. You should be living another life. Not spending it answering phones for lawyers.
Everyone has a destiny. And this isn't yours.
Just do it. Stop being afraid.
Believe me, he's our guy. He tossed his own wallet back on the train. Only reason he'd do that...
You saw that terrorist video --
How?
Torture him, you mean.
Assalam'alaikoom.
The New York Times.
Derek Frost.
You forget something?
You see this?
Now you can't blow it up.
Believe me, I'm very accurate with one of these things.
Stay there, my man.
Stop acting, for Chrissakes.
Shut up!
What about those other passengers?
This man's a terrorist. He planted a bomb on the train.
What's the next attack? Who else are you going to kill today, huh?
One more step, asshole.
Piss all you want. You took eighty million dollars to kill hundreds of people today.
Then what about the wallet, huh?
Time's up! What is it?! What is the next attack! So help me, I'll put this bullet through your brain.
I'm going to do it.
Hello.
Christina?
How can you be calling this number?
I was trying to warn you.
I'm not sure that it matters now.
I'm right here, okay? Don't be afraid.
What did you say?
you said. You knew. You knew there was going to be an evacuation. You knew before it happened. All those people walking across the...
They're going to bomb the bridges.
Christina? Just hang in there.
Just do it.
Just do it. I knew they wouldn't let me die. At least you can make me forget all of this. I hope.
What are you waiting for? You're just doing your job. I'd do the same thing if I was you. At least you've got a shot at saving those people on the bridges.
You don't think they'll save them?
Look, someone had to be where you're sitting, and someone had to be in here. Turned out it was you and me.
Just do it. I'm tired.
I don't understand.
Why would you do that?
Prisoner?
No... There's no way... There's no way you could have...
How? The Source Code was a parallel world! You told me so!
But...
You're saying I could have saved those people?!
Man. Just when I think I understand this...
They'll nail your ass for this.
Roger that.
Final transmission acknowledged.
Thank you, Goodwin.
Ain't life grand?
Maybe that's a good thing.
That train was taking you to a place you didn't want to be. But then you got off. And maybe that's a sign.
Hey.
You can do anything you want with your life. Starting right now.
Maybe some other time.
You're right. The least I can do is buy you coffee.
What's what?
Almost at Newark.
It's more of a hell hole.
Okay, bathroom's that way.
Go. Seriously.
Why do you keep calling me ma'am?
Like what?
So you drank too much last night.
Boy, you really did drink a lot last night.
Of course it is.
Take a look in the mirror, good sir.
Hey. You okay in there?
You left your bag on the seat.
I'll just leave it right out here for you.
If it'll help you remember, you've been riding this train every morning for three months.
Are you talking to me?
Pretty girl.
And you're a moron.
Ain't life grand?
I went to art school. Doesn't make me an artist.
I'd rather not.
You certainly do.
It's private. And your opinion doesn't interest me.
I wouldn't go that far.
Christina.
All of them, practically.
I know all about them.
I'm a collector of moments.
That woman over there? She's a patent attorney with three kids and a summer place on Long Island.
I haven't seen him before today.
He's cranky. Thinks the worst of people.
Everyone's dangerous.
I'm not sure I know what you mean.
Who are you?
Something's different about you today.
Most fervently.
They're all so utterly normal.
Blond, blue eyed, hyper alert. The perfect Machiavellian operative.
He's getting away...!
Ma'am? How old do you think I am?
Who were you talking to?
My pleasure, okay? It's just that you left your bag on your seat.
It's a flagrant violation of rail security, leaving a suspicious package behind and all that. Maybe you're the terrorist.
I was joking.
I had no idea you were so thoroughly weird. I'm not entirely sure I like it.
Part of what?
Who am I? I'll tell you. I'm twenty seven years old. I have no savings and no health insurance.

Six months ago I moved back in with my parents because I ran out of money. I got A's in line drawing and advanced oil painting but no one's buying my stuff. Two weeks ago I put away all my paints. My little sketch book is the last thing left. You see, I'm not a artist. I'm a receptionist in a law firm. The only thing I operate is a phone switchboard.

Now let me tell you about you. You work at the New York Public Library. You've been eyeing me for months on this train but haven't said a word to me. You're bland and colorless and predictable. And now I see you're delusional, too.
Are you mocking me?
Do me a favor. Don't ever talk to me again.
Get off me!
Is this a magic trick or something?
You want to tell me how you're doing this?
A collector of moments?
That's the cheesiest line I've ever heard.
Who the hell are you? Who have you been talking to?
Me? No. I haven't ever talked to you.
Okay, you've got my attention. Now tell me what this is all about.
Are you selling something?
This better be good.
I'm not sure.
Yes, fine! Here.
I did it last week.
Give me a little credit.
You're not really on this train.
After three months of riding the train, this is how you introduce yourself to me?
Source Code.
You are, I think, deliciously mad.
Why tell all this to me? There's lots of people around for you to talk to.
Believe me, I don't have the answer for anything.
Stone walls? My parents live in a house with aluminum siding and an American eagle over the door. The only bike is a Harley which the guy down the street revs at three in the morning.
Who's Rutledge?
I saw a program on TV. It was about psychics. They say psychics have a lot of paranoia.
Don't you have people you can go to for help? Friends, family?
Maybe now's the time to reach out to him.
As opposed to being the exact same person?
This is so not about me.
June 11th.
You're intimidated by him.
You're scared of him. I can see it.
He's still mad at you, huh?
I don't know how to help you.
I have a friend.
She works at the New York Times.
She could do some poking around.
I'm getting voice mail.

Steph, it's Christina. You know that story you're always looking to write? I might just have something for you. I met a guy. His name is Colter Stevens. He says he's in the army. He flies helicopters in Iraq, but now they've put him into a secret project called Source Code. Maybe you can look into it a bit, okay? Call me.
She'll call back. Just wait.
Ma'am? How old do you think I am?
No, but thanks.
What did you mean, there's a criminal on the train? How do you know that?
How can I help you if you don't tell me everything about this?
Can't you just tell me?
Try anything and I'll kill you.
What are you doing?
What are you --
Is that...?
Did you put this here?
We have to tell someone. We have to stop this.
Already what?
This isn't happening. I've got to get off.
Why won't it open?!
It's Steph.
I told you she'd be interested.
Hi.
Colter...?
Colter, I have to tell you something.
Stephanie did a computer search.
She's got a database of all newspaper articles going back to forever.
No. But you were. She found you.
According to the notice, you were killed in action two months ago.
Hey!
You want to get off me?
What's wrong with you, anyway?
You okay?
You're not okay.
He's not feeling well.
Wait. I'll pay it.
All right, all right.
I see customer service is alive and well on New Jersey Transit.
The ticket? I don't know. You looked a little lost.
What's that?
What?
This isn't my stop.
How do you...?
Who in the world are you?
Leave me alone.
Hello?
Going to work. Why?
What?
I don't understand.
I'm fine. Everything's normal. Is there something on the news? Some kind of alert?
I'll be late for work.
It's probably a joke. A weirdo guy from somewhere.
No. I'll call you back.
Who is this?
Are you the guy who was sitting across me on the train?
My friend had it. From when you called her -- to try and get me off the train. Who are you? What do you want?
About what?
Talk to me. I feel that something terrible's going to happen. Do I need to get off the train? Am I going to die?
Why didn't I get off the train?
I knew I should have driven in today. But then there's the bridges, right? You never know when they'll be jammed.
The bridges. You just never know when they'll be jammed.
What are you talking about. Who's going to --
What's happening? Are you okay?
What now? How do we get to work?
Hey! I'm talking to you!
Yeah. Now I'm going get fired for being late.
Could this day get any worse?
Yeah. If only.
I'm calling a cab. Maybe I'll only be somewhat late for work.
Wait.
You can't just expect someone to change her life just like that. At the very least... you'd have to buy that person coffee and explain your reasons.
You okay?
Okay, well, come on then.
Ticket?
May I see your ticket?
Have to write you up then.
New York. Penn Station.
Princeton Junction.
Lucky you.
Ticket?
Say what?
Please take a seat, sir.
Didn't I tell you to take a seat?
Who are you talking to?
You feeling all right, sir?
Very well.
Ticket.
Ticket, please.
He still needs a ticket.
Have it your way, pal.
I have no idea where he got on.
Huh?
Trust me, by one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed...
Trust me, by one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed...
Wow. Thanks.
Wow. Thanks.
Instead of going directly to the station house, Derek continues walking down the platform alongside the train, as if intending to reboard further down.
Gosh. Is that my wallet?
What the hell, man? What the hell???
What is this? Get away from me!
Jesus.
Don't hurt me.
Keep my wallet. Take my watch.
Please. I have a family.
What?
Oh God... Oh God...
Listen to him. For God's sake I'm not a terrorist...!
Eighty million dollars? I swear to you...
I don't know what you're talking about!
I would never hurt anyone. I have a family. I guess you'll have to kill me.
Anything you want... Please...
Trust me, by one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed...
Wow. Thanks.
Of course. What's this about?
My pleasure.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
All aboard. Doors are closing.
This is a New York bound train.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
All aboard. Doors are closing.
The train to Philadelphia will be four minutes late... The train to Philadelphia will be four minutes late...
Philadelphia train now approaching.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Next stop New York Penn Station.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
All aboard. Doors are closing.
This is a New York bound train.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
All aboard. Doors are closing.
Next stop New York Penn Station.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
All aboard. Doors are closing.
This is a New York bound train.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
All aboard. Doors are closing.
This is a New York bound train.
Now approaching Newark Station.
Newark Station.
Once again, please return to your seats, ladies and gentlemen.
Ladies and gentlemen, rail service has been cancelled. Please clear the platform and proceed into the station. New Jersey Transit apologizes for the inconvenience.
This is Beleaguered Castle.
Captain Colter Stevens, this is Beleaguered Castle. Acknowledge transmission.
Captain Stevens, do you copy?
You're with Beleaguered Castle.
Are you functional?
Adjusting your rotation.
Can you report at this time?
Report what you saw.
Just now.
And?
Just relax, Captain.
Standby for thread one of alpha memory pattern.
You already have that information, Captain. Now think. Recall my name.
Correct.
Commencing memory pattern.
You're with Beleaguered Castle.
You're with friends.
The exercises will assist you. Are you ready?

Memory Thread One. Listen to the following passage: "When Lily woke, she had the bed to herself. She sat up, bewildered by the strangeness of her surroundings; then memory returned, and she looked about her with a shiver.
of thread one.
Thread Two. Listen. I am holding the following hand of cards: Queen of spades. Four of clubs. Nine of clubs. Three of hearts. Nine of hearts.
I repeat: Queen of spades. Four of clubs. Nine of clubs. Three of hearts. Nine of hearts. End of thread two.
Thread Three. The following is a recording of a Western Screech-Owl: A rather spooky BIRD CALL plays -- a short whistle, followed by a long trill. The call is repeated twice more.
End of Thread Three. End of pattern. Acknowledge.
Stand by to initiate pattern recall.
The five playing cards. Arrange them in order of descending values, irrespective of suit.
That is correct. The passage I read contained mention of a woman's name. What was that name?
That is correct. End of pattern.
Please list the primary specifications of the aerial platform you've been trained to operate.
Please list the primary specifications of the aerial platform you've been trained to operate.
Please list the primary --
That is correct.
Who bombed the train?
Who bombed the train, Captain?
Whom do you suspect bombed the train?
You didn't see?
The Screech-Owl song can be seen as a progression of musical notes.
How many times was the bird call repeated?
How many times was the bird call repeated?
Incorrect. Who bombed the train, Captain?
You have seventeen minutes. Use them. Find the bomber.
Stabilize. Lower your pulse.
Do you need to urinate?
Do you need to urinate?
Did you find the bomber?
Which Middle Eastern guy? Be specific.
You've already been told what you need to know. Discipline your memory. Limit your operational awareness to the tasks we assign you. Everything else is irrelevant.
You do not die. As you can see, you simply return to us.
Say again?
The man with the pipe isn't here right now.
You feel unsatisfied with our relationship?
If Guzman, the Middle Eastern man, is innocent, as you maintain, who might be the guilty party?
This isn't a game, Captain.
We have no answers. Only corpses.
Some were too badly burned to be identified.
The heat from the explosion fused many of them completely into the wreckage.
Yes.
Yes.
Today.
It was attacked this morning, at 7:57 a.m., Eastern Standard Time.
What do your senses tell you?
With Beleaguered Castle.
Your unit was rotated Stateside three weeks ago.
Listen up, soldier.
The train is just the beginning.
Captain?
D.N.I. Counterterrorism has come up with the five most likely follow-up targets in the New York area.

They are, in no order of importance, the Holland Tunnel, Newark International Airport, the Brooklyn Bridge, Penn Station and the Empire State Building. It could be any of them, it could be none of them. Whatever it is, if you find the bomber and learn his plan, the next one we might be in a position to prevent. Those are your orders.
Those are not your orders.
Those are not your orders. You are not to influence events any more than you need to in order to accomplish your mission.
Would you like to see the release form you signed?
Only one way forward, Captain.
-- four principle dialects of Arabic: Egyptian, Gulf, Syrian-
Welcome back. How are you feeling?
You find the bomber?

Lower your pulse. The situation has worsened. The fire on the tracks caused one of the freight cars to blow up and release some kind of gas. As a precaution they're having to evacuate all of lower Manhattan.
We may have lost the initiative.
We were expecting more from you.
I want to show you something.
Yes. This drivers license photo was found with her body. We're creating a database of recovered identifications as they come in from the site.
Would you like to see her morgue photos?
We know.
This was taken shortly after the rescue crews arrived on scene.
We noted the location of each corpse when we pulled it out.
Prepare yourself. This is unedited footage.
Sean Fentress.
As a host identity, Sean Fentress had to have certain basic similarities to you. Gender.
Would you like to see the other passenger photos? Perhaps that would help you.
Why?
Captain...?
Captain, allow me to introduce myself. My name is Goodwin.
Captain?
Captain, just tell me what you see.
Very good. Very, very good.
Are you comfortable? Are you warm?
Do you need to urinate?
Beleaguered Castle is waiting for your report.
Captain, I know you can hear me.
As you're collecting your thoughts, I should tell you there's been another development. A terrorist group has taken responsibility for bombing the train.
This began broadcasting over the Internet a half hour. We've traced it to central Asia.
So you've decided to speak.
We appreciate your desire for further discussion. Perhaps at a later date.
Frankly, Captain, we're disappointed.
I have to say that we expected more from you.
Perhaps we overestimated your abilities.
Please accept the criticism in the spirit it was given. Perhaps a few memory exercises would help.
Very well. We're ready for that information.
What assurance do we have you'll be able to read the screen before the device detonates?
Captain? This is Goodwin.
Where are you, Captain?
Where are you? How did you find us?
What train?
What hasn't happened?
What explosion?
This contact is ill-advised. I must ask you to hang up.
You have no authorization to be making this call. Goodbye.
I think so.
I'd rather you not ask me anything, Captain.
I should terminate this call.
What's your question?
Not physically.
You did not physically survive the crash.
We've kept alive certain areas of your brain.
A manifestation. Your way of making sense of it.
As a soldier...
It was the only way. You couldn't have a body and be sent back into the Source Code.
What is the status of your mission?
I suppose not. You're right to keep it from me.
End?
You must realizes the army's made an investment in you. You'll be used again.
Imagine a turntable. With a record spinning on it. All we do is lift up the needle. The music stops.

Then we wait. Until another mission. And the needle comes down again. You won't remember any of this. We'll start with the playing cards. Electronic tones. Simple memory exercises. Bit by bit, we'll revive your cerebral capacities once more.
Does it matter?
In stimulating your cortex, they're prolonging your life. Many soldiers would find that preferable to death.
The courts.
The courts know you're here.
Military.
I'm sorry you found out about all of this. That wasn't our intention.
The Army investigated Colter's helicopter crash in Iraq.
No. It's the Silver Star.
I thought I might inform the captain of the citation.
The memory wipe?
Captain, this is Beleaguered Castle. Acknowledge transmission.
How are you feeling? Are you comfortable?
Come again?
I doubt it.
No. I meant, I doubt you'd be doing this, if you were me.
Would you like to see Christina again? One last time?
Seventeen minutes. That's all I could give you. No mission to fulfill. Just... the two of you.
As a favor. One prisoner to another.
You were right. About me. And about Source Code. We've kept too much from each other.
You were on the train. I was not.
We didn't know if any bleed-
No. Not in our world. The time currents are too strong. But minor alterations, here and there, a phone call, say, those might slip through. We didn't know for sure.
I've been thinking about the things you said on that call. As the day passed, the more I understood them.
There's not much time. They think I'm re-initializing the system.
If I had any feelings, I'd worry about that. But, as you've maintained, I do not.
This is Beleaguered Castle signing off. Acknowledge final transmission.
Step aside. That's an order.
I'm glad you know my rank. Were you also aware I'm in the Special Forces?
Hello, Captain.
Thank you for your service. Time to go home.
Go ahead and arrest me.
I'll be around. Whenever you want me.
I am minding my business. Tell him to mind his.
Motion sickness, I'm afraid. I believe I will get off at the next stop.
Excuse me... Please let me through...
I resent this. This is harassment.
I have no idea what you're talking about. I am an international business man. An executive.
I will prove nothing to you. Leave me alone.
Excuse me.
There. Now you have two wallets.
Just what is this about?
Don't treat him like this. He's not an animal. Neither are you.
You see? You are a human being.
This can be worked out. We can listen to each other.
Hey, you dropped this.
Hey, you dropped this.
Hey, you dropped this.
Lots of guys come through here.
Project designer initiating sequence and drives check.
Is someone there?
Wow! It's you.
We've been working towards you from the other side. Nice to have you with us again. You feeling all right?
The name's Rutledge.
No, I guess not. They're pretty anal around here.
Don't tell them you saw me smoking in here, okay?
I prefer the term project designer.
What?
Why would Goodwin have it in for you?
He seems pretty devoted to the mission.
Because they can't be saved.
Yeah but you'd be doing it in the Source Code, not here. Not in our own past.
I'm not sure I should be telling you this.
It's quantum physics. Linear algebra. Parabolic calculus. It would take weeks to explain.
It's gone out again.
Think of it like this: events in our past can never be undone.
So Source Code opens up another past for you. A parallel past. It looks the same but it has no intersection with our own world.
I don't know. You can never know that because you're not there to observe it. Maybe it vanishes.
What bicycle?
Wait. You see all this after you leave the train?
Please tell me you're not making this up.
I don't know.
They're here. There's no more time to talk.
Make sure he sends you back in.
How's it going? Any breakthroughs?
Believe me, Captain, I'm on your side.
Look, it's been a long day. For all of us. But now we've got to bring this home and catch a killer.
Come on. These guys are serious.
If you think I'm enjoying this, you're wrong.

The government can decide to take an interest in people. People like your father with his struggling farm. It can discover things like unpaid property taxes. It can call in his equipment loans or tie him down for years in environmental litigation. On the other hand, it can pay him handsomely for mineral deposits he never knew were there.
They're meaningless. Nerves firing. Brain chemistry.
You can see it. But you can never get there without our help.
Our offer. Maybe we can get you there. In return for your completing the mission.
They'll let you die. I'll shut off your life support and you'll simply slip away.
Just like the good Lord intended you to do a few months back.

Actually, we haven't. Your operational awareness has become too great. If you found out the truth about yourself once, you might do so again. As for Source Code, I'm sure we can find other servicemen coming back from overseas with wounds just like yours.
Do you have the courage to serve your country one final time?
The display screen on the detonator was a useful and exciting insight you made. This time, make it pay off. Get the information on the screen. But let the bomb explode.
I doubt that.
Captain?
It's okay. Calm yourself. You're back.
What happened?
Was the bomber's identity on the cell phone?
What about the phone itself? Make, model, product identification number.
Did you make any other progress?
We can do this all day. Until you get it right.
I don't doubt it. Who's the bomber?
They've searched the wreckage and found the wallet. It was under the wall panel. Just as you said.
...is if he wanted us to think he died in the explosion. I know.
We looked into his profile.
Derek Frost is a commodities trader, with a wife, two children and a promotion one month old.
If he's really the one, you can find out the rest of his plan.
By any means necessary. There is no Geneva Convention in the Source Code.
Find out the plan, before it happens here. And then I'll let you die.
In the conductor's compartment there's a fully loaded 9 millimeter handgun locked in a safe. Think you can remember the combination?
Yes... We appreciate that... I just hope the information has come in time to clear the bridges... Thank you, sir.
Whether or not they can stop the bridge attack, we came up with the intelligence. And that virtually assures all of our futures. This is just the beginning, guys.
You did a great job, Goodwin. You operated our captain with skill and professionalism. What's that you have?
What's this, then? Some kind of posthumous reprimand for reckless flying?
Send it on to his father. It'll ease the pain of his son's death.
Better not. We can't risk acquainting him with the citation in case the memory wipe isn't entirely clean.

I know, I know. But now the Director of National Intelligence is sure to want a closer look at our program, and until we train up another candidate, we'll need to keep Colter around to demonstrate it.
This thing is much bigger than any one of us. Goodwin, please clear Colter's memories and re-initialize Source Code.
Thank you, sir... I appreciate your faith in me... It's a great day for our country.
This is Rutledge.
Shit.
What is this? Who authorized this?
Where's Goodwin?
What the hell is he doing?
Shut it down.
Shut down the Source Code. Right now.
Fine. I'll do it myself.
And why not?
Let it finish, then. No harm in that, I guess.
All of you are in deep shit, I promise you. As for Goodwin, he'll never make it off this base.
He wouldn't.
Seal the ICU. I want a detachment of MPs meeting me on the way there.
What?!
I want to know who reprogrammed this lock. And if you don't get this open in ten seconds I'll see that you're busted back down to private.
Just open it! A man's life is at stake.
Shoot him if you have to, you hear me?
Make it ten.
Arrest him!
He's dying...!
Get a medical team in here! Move!
What are you standing there for?!
I guess force is the only thing you people understa --
You're a murderer.
The video monitor shows CHRISTINA's DMV shot. Her wry, secretive smile.
Hello?
Now you listen to me. Whoever you are, never call here again.
50 SECONDS.
Reads 20 SECONDS.
Never any damn leg room on a plane.
Hey, this guy's crashing...
Hearing Test. First sequence.
Hearing Test. First sequence.
Goodwin stops the audio.
By now you have suffered a taste of divine vengeance. God willing, you will soon suffer another.

These attacks will show you that you will never be safe. You can secure your borders. But what can you do against one of your own citizens? One who looks like you, who is blameless, living already among you, who takes eighty million of our dollars, a trifle, and carries out our bidding? You cannot stop this. Time has run out.
Hey, do you have my phone?
Dude, give me back my phone!
No!
Operator. City and listing.
Connecting you.
What listing?
Post Operator.
Yes, sir. How may I direct your call?
I have no listing for a Captain Colter Stevens.
One moment, sir.
C Deck.
C Deck.
You have the wrong number.
Would you repeat that?
Hold the line.
Colter is slumped in a corner. Christina appears. Taps him on the shoulder.
There's nothing there. Whatever Derek tossed inside is gone.
Christina? It's Stephanie. Where are you right now?
The strangest thing. The phone rang at my desk and some guy I don't know said the train you're on isn't safe and that you should get off at the next stop. Then he hung up.
Maybe you should get off. Are you okay?
Nothing that I've heard.
I think you should get off.
The hell with work, Christina! You hate that job anyway.
Did you get off...?
I thought we were going to let him die.
Oh.
We don't know, sir. But Source Code is up and running again.
No idea, sir.
Sir?
I wouldn't do that.
We've never interrupted Source Code in mid run. We'd have to literally pull the plug. It could damage the processors.
I don't think that's where he's headed.
Derek Frost.
Mr. Frost. Please turn to face us.
Place your hands in the air.
I'm already a private, sir.
Give me twenty seconds.
So you have no idea how your cell phone was used to call in the tip?
Metro Cab Dispatch.
Hello...?
